subcategories.name: Joint-space commands
subcategories.what_is_covered: Direct numerical inputs to individual joints or actuators, bounded by hardware limits.
subcategories.typical_examples: joint torques/positions/velocities; high-dimensional joint commands; bounded control inputs; finger-joint configs; parametrised joint trajectories

subcategories.name: Vehicle / body dynamics commands
subcategories.what_is_covered: Low-level controls that change a mobile base, ground-vehicle or aerial body state.
subcategories.typical_examples: steering angle; throttle / acceleration; braking; linear & angular velocity; body-rate thrust; speed/direction for locomotion; lane-keeping

subcategories.name: End-effector & gripper pose
subcategories.what_is_covered: 6-DoF goals and time-parameterised trajectories for arms, grippers or aerial manipulators.
subcategories.typical_examples: continuous 6-DoF poses; pose deltas (Δx, Δy, Δz, Δroll, Δpitch, Δyaw); gripper open/close; gripper width/force; grasp trajectories

subcategories.name: Base / waypoint trajectories
subcategories.what_is_covered: Desired paths, way-points or velocity profiles for the robot body or ego vehicle.
subcategories.typical_examples: waypoint/path-goal selection; future trajectory sequences; base linear & angular velocity commands; lane-change/merge trajectories

subcategories.name: Manipulation skills
subcategories.what_is_covered: Object-centred primitives that parameterise targets, forces or object states.
subcategories.typical_examples: grasp/pick; place/drop; push/pull; rotate/open/close; part deformation

subcategories.name: Locomotion & navigation skills
subcategories.what_is_covered: Discrete moves or gait switches for repositioning the whole robot.
subcategories.typical_examples: move_forward/stop; turn_left/turn_right; gait switch; lane keeping/change; overtaking/merging; "go to X"

subcategories.name: Interaction & instruction skills
subcategories.what_is_covered: Multimodal actions expressed through gesture, speech or scene edits.
subcategories.typical_examples: gesture actions; speech actions; instructional guidance; scene editing commands
